pros: An employer that values hard work and performance with generous bonus schemes, a flexible pattern of working and competitive pay. A variety of venues makes it interesting, and better than being at a desk all day!
cons: Sometimes the distances required to travel, although mostly they are local. Travel contribution is paid to compensate for this though. If the weather is bad, venues can be quiet.

review_title: A great job working for a lovely organisation!
pros: *Not being tied to a desk! *The variety of venues I get to work at from beautiful nature reserves, local markets to big shows at the NEC! *Meeting and engaging with lots of different people at the different venues and events. *The whole team are super friendly and supportive, your Team Leaders, peers and the back office team, who do everything from arranging your venues to making sure you have the correct materials and equipment to carry out your job! *Good training and career development opportunities, the company promotes from within.

review_title: Worthwhile but management support could be improved
pros:
Great charity to support
Mostly outdoors
Fairly independent working
cons:
